ingredients: 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a bowl, combine the pork cubes with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Sear the pork cubes in the hot oil until browned on all sides. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
Add the green pepper to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until slightly softened.
Return the pork to the skillet. Add the sake, powdered sugar, and bay leaves.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the black beans. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, allowing the beans to heat through.
Stir in the sesame oil, chopped parsley, and cilantro.
Serve hot, garnished with extra chopped parsley and cilantro if desired.
response.name: Sake-Glazed Pork with Black Beans and Green Pepper
